title: Teams desk to mobile is seamless
text: I’m always having to do things in this Covid    The way I can get messages, join meetings, and get calls on my cell is tremendously easy. I’m never out of touch and always accessible when I want to be. This blows Skype away with stability and functionality. I can view presentations and even video if I’m in Starbucks or a place with Wi-Fi. Download it today if you use it on your laptop or work computer.  I am very happy with this app

title: Fix notifications
text: Easy to use and clearly organized. Main issue is how it handles notifications; the settings should be easier to customize and message notifications get dropped. This isn’t the biggest issue if you regularly check the app, but the messages can sometimes disappear from Notification Center, making it difficult to quickly check. Otherwise the app works as advertised.

title: Annoying glitch or bug of some sort.
text:
I don’t normally write a review for an app, but since this is an  important one, I figured I would. I’ve recently run into a bug or a glitch of some kind where I cannot open any recent assignments that were posted. This is not good since I use the app for school. I will click the ‘view assignment’ button, but it just goes grey, then nothing happens. I’ve tried deleting the app then re-downloading it, but that didn’t work either. If there is any solution, please let me know.

—Christian Vandiver.

title: Need to be able to customize notification sounds
text: We need the ability to customize what sound is played for a notification. Right now we can only turn on and off the sound, which ability to choose what sound should be played. It just uses the default iOS notification sound -  just like so many other apps. It would be helpful to be able to distinguish these notifications from other apps.

title: My Opinion
text: My school uses this app for online school because of the coronavirus. I think this app is pretty good. I love the little animations after you turn in the assignments! I have a suggestion to making the app more better. For the “Assignments” category, you should list all of the assignments in all of the teams that the account is in by the date they’re due instead of picking individual teams because that will take a lot of time. I’m sorry if my opinion is bad or it offends you. Thank you for reading this, and have a nice day!

title: Works great for a free product!
text: We use this as a communication platform where I work. Its great when you use it to organize teams and make sure to communicate on the appropriate channel for future reference purposes. Has built in personal Wikis and tons of 3rd party addins. We dont use a lot of the features available, but overall we like it. We were kind of thinking about using slack for communication, but this works just as well. Its just not as simple to use at first.

title: It’s not Slack, but it’s getting better
text:
The stability of the audio quality and screen sharing capability for TEAMS as compared to LYNC or the updated SKYPE FOR BUSINESS is MUCH better than the older two. 

Wish Microsoft would allow easier switching between TEAMS — I have to completely log out, and completely re-authenticate to log into the other team. In Slack, it’s a simple click to switch teams. 

Fix that and my day would be much more sunny than it is now.

title: Love the Team app, but have a suggestion

title: Love teams

Overall i recommend teams to any employer

title: Read app

title: Request to show phone call/meeting minutes

title: iOS App is Slowww on iPhone

title: Lag issues and don’t get notifications

title: Why is this not in the Mac App Store?
text: If I could give this zero stars I would. Using an app on your phone for a work video meeting with screen sharing is terrible. title: Invasive. It’s like a virus

title: Intermittent call issues

title: Still not full-featured enough and everything in one window so awkward to use
text: Like many of the features, esp. the ability to use it from my phone, but it’s still feels like a preteen product not yet in puberty. Once it’s a grown-up, I’ll like it better - I hope!

title: Lack of notifications holding it back
text: I’ve been using Teams and while it isn’t as robust as Slack it has some nice features that integrates it with other Microsoft products. The frustrating part is that I’ve turned on, followed, and allowed every setting I can but Teams fails to consistently alert me to messages posted to a team. I’ve responded hours and days late to messages. Either someone has to @ me personally or I have to stare at the app and watch the message happen. Hopefully that’s smoothed out.

title: Huge improvement on other conferencing tools I have used
text:
Sound and video quality is great. 
Sharing files, recording the meetings is great. 
Transferring devices mid meeting is super smooth. I often need to switch from phone to laptop and back. Automated close captioning is pretty amazing. 

Only downside I see a lot is that I have to set computer audio before I share if I want to share a company movie.

title: Getting Better
text: Microsoft has always lagged in the app dept and it seems everyone beats them to the market with innovation. Office 365 is starting to get it together and decide what it wants to be. Teams is a solid platform to get your company using these tools and this app is solid. It needs a ton of tweaks,  but the simplicity built into the initial design is worthy of respect and I hope that doesn’t get lost with upgrades. It needs to stay simple so people and figure it out on their own. But it needs to evolve and gain some more robust features.

title: A great collaboration tool and step away from email clutter
text:
So far, teams has become a great platform for my team to work on projects, host daily meetings - where my team comes prepared due to the group accountability that Teams provides - and as a general chat functionality.  I like the app, and i love the ability to move all of the software I use that is secure and approved with our infosec team.  

Some interface improvements could be that when you work on a Team PowerPoint, the slides can be small due to margin layout.  There is a little bit of lag on what other team members are doing in a document, so you need to have a few seconds, sometimes a minute of patience if collaborating on a document.

Overall, very impressed and I recommend this. 

Nick Berardi
Associate Mgr Logistics at Tesla, Inc.
